intro: Dontospermum mogadorense, commonly known as the Canary Island rock rose, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in clusters. It thrives in rocky and well-drained soils, often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
